Hi all:

I'm a relative newcomer to the Heritrix software. I have a couple =
of question about Heritrix' handling of HTML forms which I have been unable=
 to answer through the manuals or Javadocs. (I haven't looked at the code..=
 yet)  I'm using version 1.4.0.

I assume from the behaviour I see that Her=
itrix will attempt to crawl "through" HTML forms. I assume it does this in =
extractorHTML class, and simply "submits" the forms without supplying any v=
alues.  Can anyone confirm (or deny) this? 

It appears (in my case) that i=
t does this even when the form has the attribute

   method=3D"post"

indic=
ating an HTTP POST instead of an HTTP GET. Again, Can anyone confirm or den=
y?


In practice, the problem I am seeing is really the fault of the Web si=
te: it uses a relative URL as the "action" for the form, and re-uses the sa=
me form on several different pages, thus generating a range of invalid URLs=
, but the nature of the site is to quietly accept these bad URLs... what a =
mess.  Here's an example URL if anyone is interested:

  http://blog.greens=
.org.nz/index.php/2005/06/28/

the "Subscribe" button mid-way down the righ=
t-hand column effectively takes you back to the homepage with a mangled, bu=
t valid, URL.


However, I'm curious (and a little concerned) about the HTM=
L form behaviour noted above. Any advice on these issues would be appreciat=
ed.

Gordon
